title: Zapps and Warping and Forging
subtitle: -- building towards portable, composable un-distros
abstract: Zapps are a portable packaging format for linux executables that works on every distro, ever -- and indeed, even on FreeBSD. Warpforge is a build sandboxing and package releasing tool based on hashes-go-in-hashes-come-out, hyperfocused on reproducibility and explainability.  Both are part of a quest to build a more freely-composable story for how we work with our computers and share our software.
